analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:
“Monks, there are these two things to be regretted.

original: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco akatakalyāṇo hoti, akatakusalo, akatabhīruttāṇo, katapāpo, kataluddo, katakibbiso.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave ekaccaḥ akata kalyāṇaḥ hoti akata kusalaḥ akata bhīruttāṇaḥ kata pāpaḥ kata luddaḥ kata kibbisaḥ
translated: There is the case where a person has not done what is good, has not done what is skillful, has not made an island for himself, has not made a refuge for himself, has not made an island or a refuge for himself. He has done evil, has done unskillful things, has been cruel.

original: So ‘akataṁ me kalyāṇan’tipi tappati, ‘kataṁ me pāpan’tipi tappati.
analyzed: saḥ a katam me kalyāṇan tipi tappati katam me pāpan tipi tappati
translated: He regrets what he has not done: ‘I have not done what is good. I have not done what is skillful. I have not made an island for myself, have not made a refuge for myself, have not made an island or a refuge for myself. I have done evil, have done unskillful things, have been cruel.’

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve dhammā tapanīyā”ti.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave dve dhammā tapanīyā ati
translated: These are the two things to be regretted.”
And in reference to this, they say:

analyzed: yat caññam dosa sañhita  a katvā kusalam kamma
translated: and whatever else is mixed with hate,🔽not having done what is skillful,
having done much that is not skillful,
at the break-up of the body, the witless one

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This, too, was the meaning of what was said by the Blessed One, so I have heard.
